intro: Mesembryanthemum opticum, commonly known as the optical mesem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in fine hairs, which help it conserve water in arid environments. Mesembryanthemum opticum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
